description: Students analyse a dataset and write a scientific report from one of the workshops to test a hypothesis in the Wild Deserts Ecological Health and Monitoring Framework (e.g., camera trapping or vegetation quadrat dataset).
Students present research on a given desert ecology topic after discussing with academics/instructors, followed by class feedback.
End-of-course test assessing understanding of restoration ecology concepts, field skills (e.g., animal track/scat identification, ecosystem types), and techniques (e.g., animal capture/tagging).
